original_title: R M Parks to invest US$110mn in Sri Lanka fuel distribution
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – US-based RM Parks Inc. has signed an agreement to invest 110 million US dollars in fuel distribution, in collaboration with Shell Plc, the Board of Investment of Lanka said.
R M Parks will operate 150 former Ceylon Petroleum Corporation franchise pumping stations and 50 new ones.

It has a long-term agreement with the Power and Energy Ministry to import and sell petrol, diesel, kerosene and furnace oil, expand its business to distribution of other petroleum or gas products, including aviation fuel and EV charging
It is will also provide value-added services such as car wash, car service, department stores/ convenience stores, internet café, ATM and food courts.
